content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="0.5 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> is attached to a horizontal spring with a spring constant of <math alttext="150 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>150</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></math>. The block is released from rest at position <math alttext="x equals 0.05 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>, as shown, and undergoes simple harmonic motion, reaching a maximum position of <math alttext="x equals 0.1 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. The speed of the block when it passes through position <math alttext="x equals 0.09 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.09</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="0.35 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.35</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="0.43 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.43</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="0.75 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.75</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.35 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.35</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
